summary: This bill, the Judicial Understaffing Delays Getting Emergencies Solved Act of 2025 (JUDGES Act of 2025), addresses judicial understaffing in the U.S. District Courts. It authorizes the appointment of additional district judges across various districts in multiple states, staggered over several years (2029-2039). The bill also creates a temporary judgeship, amends existing U.S. Code sections related to court organization, and mandates GAO reports on judicial caseloads and detention space needs. Additionally, it requires the public release of the Judicial Conference's judgeship recommendations.
